lead_paragraph: Under President Rodrigo Duterte, 712 suspects have died in police operations and 1,067 have been killed by vigilantes, the nation’s police chief says.

byline.contributor: Felipe Villamor reported from Manila, and Richard C. Paddock from Bangkok.
byline.original: By FELIPE VILLAMOR and RICHARD C. PADDOCK

headline.print_headline: 1,800 Killed in 7 Weeks in Philippine Drug War
headline.main: Nearly 1,800 Killed in Duterte’s Drug War, Philippine Police Official Tells Senators

snippet: Under President Rodrigo Duterte, 712 suspects have died in police operations and 1,067 have been killed by vigilantes, the nation’s police chief says....
abstract: Police and vigilantes in Philippines have killed nearly 1,800 people in seven weeks since Pres Rodrigo Duterte assumed office, under his strong directive to end illegal drug trade in country; deaths elicit mixed reactions from citizens who support ridding streets of drug trade, but many express horror over idea of extrajudicial killings.
